intro: Sorolepidium duthiei, commonly known as the Duthie's sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils, often in wetlands or along the edges of water bodies. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and habitat conservation.
